Package com.bfo.json

Class JsonReadOptions

java.lang.Object
com.bfo.json.JsonReadOptions
public class JsonReadOptions extends Object

This class controls the details of the Json.read() call. The various flags set on this class can control the read process, and in some cases (e.g. setStrictTypes(boolean)) determines how the objects behave after they are read.

The class uses a "fluent" style to enable setting multiple options at once, eg. 

  json.read(out, new JsonReadOptions().setAllowUnquotedKey(true).setAllowComments(true));

All flags default to false.

    • setAllowUnquotedKey

      public JsonReadOptions setAllowUnquotedKey(boolean unquotedKey)
      Whether to allow unquotedKey keys in the JSON input. This is not officially allowed, but still common. The default is false.
      Parameters:
      unquotedKey - the flag
      Returns:

      public JsonReadOptions setContextFree(boolean nocontext)
      Whether to turn off tracking of the line, column and context of the reader when reading from a file, which is used when reporting errors. This is on by default, but slows down reading by about 1.5%
      Parameters:
      nocontext - the flag

    • setBigDecimal

      public JsonReadOptions setBigDecimal(boolean bigDecimal)
      Set whether real numbers that cannot be guaranteed to be exactly the same when stored as a Double should be stored as a BigDecimal. The default is false, which means every real number read by the JsonReader will be converted to a Double.
      Parameters:
      bigDecimal - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • isBigDecimal

      public boolean isBigDecimal()
      Return the value of the "bigDecimal" flag as set by setBigDecimal(boolean)
      Returns:
      the flag

    • setStrictTypes

      public JsonReadOptions setStrictTypes(boolean strictTypes)
      Determines whether objects read by the JsonReader will be loosely typed. With this flag set, calling Json.intValue() on the string "123" will result in a ClassCastException being thrown rather than a silent conversion to integer.
      Parameters:
      strictTypes - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • isStrictTypes

      public boolean isStrictTypes()
      Return the value of the "strictTypes" flag as set by setStrictTypes(boolean)
      Returns:
      the flag

    • setLooseEmptyStrings

      public JsonReadOptions setLooseEmptyStrings(boolean looseEmptyStrings)
      When the strictTypes flag is not set, this flag will determine whether empty strings evaluate to zero when treated as a number and false when treated as a boolean.
      Parameters:
      looseEmptyStrings - the flag
      Returns:
      this

    • setCborStringCodingErrorAction

      public JsonReadOptions setCborStringCodingErrorAction(CodingErrorAction action)
      When reading CBOR/Msgpack, if a String is encountered where the UTF-8 encoding is incorrect, the specified action will be performed. The default is CodingErrorAction.REPLACE
      Parameters:
      action - the action
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      2

    • getCborStringCodingErrorAction

      public CodingErrorAction getCborStringCodingErrorAction()
      Return the CodingErrorAction set by setCborStringCodingErrorAction(java.nio.charset.CodingErrorAction) is incorrect, the specified action will be performed. The default is CodingErrorAction.REPLACE
      Returns:
      the action
      Since:

    • setCborFailOnUnknownTypes

      public JsonReadOptions setCborFailOnUnknownTypes(boolean flag)
      When reading a CBOR stream that contains undefined, but technically valid types, by default these will be collapsed to null with a tag set on them to indicate the original type. Setting this flag will, instead, cause the stream to fail.
      Parameters:
      flag - the flag
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      2

    • isCborFailOnUnknownTypes

      public boolean isCborFailOnUnknownTypes()
      Return the value of the "cborFailOnUnknownTypes" flag, as set by setCborFailOnUnknownTypes(boolean)
      Returns:
      the flag
      Since:
      2

    • setFailOnNonStringKeys

      public JsonReadOptions setFailOnNonStringKeys(boolean flag)
      When reading CBOR/Msgpack and a map key is encountered that is not a String, fail rather than converting it silently to a String. This API (and Json) only allow map keys to be strings.
      Parameters:
      flag - the flag
      Returns:
      this
      Since:
      3
